channel.title: Simulations on The New Golden Hammer
channel.description: Recent content in Simulations on The New Golden Hammer

item.title: Simulation Stimulation Part 3: Implementation.
item.description: Normal and Poisson models Preparatory steps Possion model simulations Normal model simulations Rankings Model: Tanh Postscript: How are my models fairing so far? Parts 1 and 2 of this series made attempts to model, and them simulate, the 2018 and 2019 AFL seasons. These models were extremely simplistic, but were none-the-less interesting. Normal and Poisson models Preparatory steps #average H or A Average <- pointssummary %>% group_by(HorA, FororAgainst) %>% summarise(Points = mean(Points)) Homeaveragefor <- as.

item.title: Simulation Stimulation Part 2: AFL Season 2019
item.description: The Models: A Reminder Poisson Distributed Team Scores Normally Distributed team scores Rankings model: tanh 2019 Results Poisson model Normal model Tanh model Comparing the three models. In part one of this series, I applied three different models to the 2018 AFL season. In this part, I apply these models to the 2019 AFL fixture to attempt to make some predictions about the standings at the end of the year.

item.title: Simulation Stimulation: AFL Season 2018
item.description: The Models Poisson Distributed Team Scores Normally Distributed team scores Rankings model: tanh The Data Results Poisson model Normal model Tanh model Comparing the three models. Graphs Poisson Results Graph Norm Results Graph Rankings Model Graph Comparison Graphs Conclusion Recently I was, as I am (unfortunately) rather wont to do, aimlessly watching YouTube videos when I came across these two videos by Numberphile. Here, the authors discuss their attempts at modelling and simulating seasons of the English Premier League.
